did.unittitle: Kentucky Coalition to Abolish the Death Penalty Records
did.abstract: This collection documents the lobbying and advocacy efforts of the Kentucky Coalition to Abolish the Death Penalty (KCADP) in its endeavor to end the use of capital punishment in the state of Kentucky.
did.physloc: The materials are located onsite in the department.

scopecontent.head: Content Description
scopecontent.p: This collection of the Kentucky Coalition to Abolish the Death Penalty (KCADP) includes digital and physical files: correspondence, administrative records (founding documents, meeting minutes, financial reports), newsclippings, court documents, communication and outreach materials, newsletters, subject files, case files, legislative activities, and video.
This collection contains multiple file types of the advocacy videos that were used by the KCADP on social media. Alternate files types can be accessed via request.

accessrestrict.head: Access
accessrestrict.p: Access to this collection is unrestricted.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: All items in this collection were donated by Pat Delahanty in 2022.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Preferred citation for this material is as follows:

Identification of specific item, series, box, folder, Kentucky Coalition to Abolish the Death Penalty Records, 1965-2022. M.E. Grenander Department of Special Collections and Archives, University Libraries, University at Albany, State University of New York (hereafter referred to as the Kentucky Coalition to Abolish the Death Penalty Records).

arrangement.head: Arrangement of the Collection
arrangement.p: The collection is made up of ten series, each arranged chronologically.

bioghist.head: Historical Note
bioghist.p: The Kentucky Coalition to Abolish the Death Penalty (KCADP) seeks to end capital punishment in Kentucky through education, outreach, coalition-building, and grassroots organizing.

The KCADP has its roots in two other organizations - the Louisville chapter of the Southern Coalition on Jails and Prisons, established in 1976 and which thrived for about a decade, and the Kentucky Civil Liberties Union which provided an organizing foundation for the KCADP beginning in 1984.
A state steering committee formed in 1986, the KCADP began to distribute newsletters in 1987, and the organization was formally incorporated in 1988.
In 1996, the KCADP put forward a "Racial Justice Act" bill that passed at the House of Representatives but failed at the Senate. It was reproposed in 1998 and passed as Senate Bill 171.
The KCADP applied for the Death Penalty Mobilization Fund (DPMF) Grants from the combined Tides Foundation and The Advocacy Fund from the years of 2009-2014, 2016, 2017, 2021, and 2022.

KCADP also partnered with organizations including the American Bar Association, the American Law Institute, Conservatives Concerned About the Death Penalty, the Kentucky Innocence Project, the Knights of Columbus, Murder Victim Families of Kentucky, and Witness to Innocence to further their collective abolishment goals. KCADP also worked in collaboration with Sister Helen Prejean, a leading advocate in the United States for the abolition of the death penalty by hosting events for Sister Helen to speak on her book and her work as an abolitionist.

separatedmaterial.head: Separated Materials
separatedmaterial.p: The archivist transferred the books: "Politics Religion and Death: Memoir of a Lobbyist" and "The Second Grave: A Case for the Abolition of the Death Penalty" both by Carl Wedekind to the book division of Special Collections. They were cataloged and included in the University Library Catalog.

did.unittitle: Advocacy Efforts

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series contains videos (in various digital formats) that were created for social media to advocate for the abolishment of the death penalty, a call campaign to legislators, documents surrounding tabling at the Kentucky State Fair, polling efforts and results, and testimonies.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This series is arranged into seven subseries.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series contains documents from the courier-journal project, emaiol communications, Kentucky Coalition to Abolish the Death Penalty (KCADP) mailing lists and press contacts, memos, physical and born digital news articles for state and nationwide newspapers/journals, KCADP newsletters, postcards, press releases, and public news service usage reports.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This series is arranged into nine subseries.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series contains materials involving the Catholic church's efforts to support the abolition of the death penalty through the Kentucky Coalition to Abolish the Death Penalty (KCADP); including: training to equip church leaders for advocacy, the evangelical call to civic responsibility, the Ministry Against Death Penalty, and the Kentucky Council of Churches.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series contains documents relating to legislative efforts made to abolish the death penalty in the state of Kentucky, including: legislation for the years 2011, 2012, 2015, 2016, 2019, 2020, 2022, and 2023 and "Abolition Now!" for the years 2002, 2003, 2004, and 2006, records relating to abolishing the death penalty due to the high cost of tax payers, records relating to sentencing because of racial bias, documents regarding mental ineptitude as a reason not to execute, documents relating to sentencing and appeals of death row inmates, court documents, execution protocol, the Innocence Project, law enforcement booklets, letters to legislators, notes from KCADP member meetings with legislators, and studies regarding the death penalty.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Included with this series are lists of intended targets for the advertising sets that include the addresses of House of Representative members, Senators, Catholic priests, parishoners, and voters, all of which we have refrained from digitally uploading.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series contains materials used by the Kentucky Coalition to Abolish the Death Penalty to market their organization to new members and legislators. This includes digital campaigns, postcards, social media campaigns, photographs, organization and campaign logos, and the ABA modified brochure to be sent to state govenors.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series contains the partner organizations that the Kentucky Coalition to Abolish the Death Penalty worked with as a part of their advocacy efforts, including: the American Bar Association, the American Law Institute, Conservatives Concerned About the Death Penalty, the Kentucky Innocence Project, the Knights of Columbus, Murder Victim Families of Kentucky, and Witness to Innocence.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The Research and Subject Files series contains materials related to abolishing the death penalty in other states, marketing and organization guides (utilized by the Kentucky Coalition to Abolish the Death Penalty but not written for them specifically), and other death penalty related reports.
